poem:
Braddies in the Air  

In the shadow of screens,  
a quiet voice awards;  
celluloid dreams linger  
unseen by countless eyes.  
Two letters weave worry  
in the rooms of the mind,  
as light flickers on walls,  
whispering to the dark.  
Beneath the gloss of gold,  
silence writes its own script.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
